ichor.core.multipoles package

Submodules

ichor.core.multipoles.dipole module

atomic_contribution_to_molecular_dipole(q00, q10: float, q11c: float, q11s: float, atomic_coordinates: ndarray)

Calculates the atomic contribution to the molecular dipole moment.

Note

This is contribution of ONE atom.

Parameters:

  • q10 – AIMAll q10 value

  • q11c – AIMAll q11c value

  • q11s – AIMAll q11s value

  • atomic_coordinates – 1D numpy array containing the x,y,z values (in bohr)

dipole_cartesian_to_spherical(d: ndarray) → Tuple[float, float, float]
dipole_one_term_general_expression(alpha: int, displacement_vector: ndarray, monopole: float, dipole: ndarray) → float

Origin chage of the x,y, or z component of the dipole moment by a displacement vector

Parameters:

  • alpha – 0, 1, or 2 for x, y, or z

  • displacement_vector – np.ndarray containing x,y,z components of displacement vector

  • monopole – monopole moment, float (charge of atom or system). Note that for AIMAll, the q00 in the AIMAll .int file does not have the nuclear charge added ichor automatically does that when parsing .int files.

  • dipole – The atomic or molecular dipole moment np.ndarray containing x,y,z components of displacement vector (Cartesian)

Returns:

The x,y or z component of the dipole moment as seen from a new origin.

dipole_rotate_cartesian(d: ndarray, C: ndarray) → ndarray
dipole_spherical_to_cartesian(q10, q11c, q11s) → ndarray
displace_dipole_cartesian(displacement_vector: ndarray, monopole: float, dipole)

Computes the full displaced dipole moment

Parameters:

  • displacement_vector – Displacement vector

  • monopole – monopole moment, float (charge of atom or system). Note that for AIMAll, the atomic q00 (monopole) in the AIMAll .int file does not have the nuclear charge added ichor automatically does that when parsing .int files.

  • dipole – The atomic or molecular dipole moment np.ndarray containing x,y,z components of displacement vector (Cartesian

Returns:

np.ndarray of shape 3 containing x,y, and z components of displaced dipole moment

get_gaussian_and_aimall_molecular_dipole(gaussian_output: GaussianOutput, ints_directory: IntsDir)

Gets the Gaussian dipole moment (still in Debye) Also gets the AIMAll recovered molecule dipole moment from atomic ones.

Returns a tuple of numpy arrays, where the first one is the Gaussian traceless dipole moment (in Debye) and the second one is the AIMAll recovered traceless dipole moment (also converted from au to Debye)

This allows for direct comparison of AIMAll to Gaussian.

Parameters:

  • gaussian_output – A Gaussian output file containing molecular multipole moments and geometry. The same geometry and level of theory must also be used in the AIMAll calculation.

  • ints_directory – A IntsDirectory instance containing the AIMAll .int files for the same geometry that was used in Gaussian

Returns:

A tuple of np.ndarrays of shape (3,) , where the first is the Gaussian dipole moment and the second is the AIMAll recovered dipole moment.

pack_cartesian_dipole(d_x, d_y, d_z)
q10_prime(q10: float, r_z: float, q00: float)

Calculates math:Q’_{10}, representing the total ATOMIC contribution for the molecular dipole moment.

Note

This is the contribution of one atom, which needs to be summed over to get the molecular value. Also, make sure the units for multipole moments / distances are correct.

Parameters:

  • q_10 – AIMAll Q_10 value

  • r_z – Distance of atom from the origin in the z-direction. In Bohr.

  • q_omega – The charge of the atom (q00). Note that this AIMAll gives q00 without adding the nuclear charge. When obtaining q00 through ichor, the nuclear charge is always added to the q00 value.

q11c_prime(q11c: float, r_x: float, q00: float)

Calculates math:Q’_{11c}, representing the total ATOMIC contribution for the molecular dipole moment.

Note

This is the contribution of one atom, which needs to be summed over to get the molecular value. Also, make sure the units for multipole moments / distances are correct.

Parameters:

  • q_10 – AIMAll Q_11c value

  • r_x – Distance of atom from the origin in the x-direction. In Bohr.

  • q_omega – The charge of the atom (q00). Note that this AIMAll gives q00 without adding the nuclear charge. When obtaining q00 through ichor, the nuclear charge is always added to the q00 value.

q11s_prime(q11s: float, r_y: float, q00: float)

Calculates math:Q’_{11s}, representing the total ATOMIC contribution for the molecular dipole moment.

Note

This is the contribution of one atom, which needs to be summed over to get the molecular value. Also, make sure the units for multipole moments / distances are correct.

Parameters:

  • q_10 – AIMAll Q_11c value

  • r_y – Distance of atom from the origin in the y-direction. In Bohr.

  • q_omega – The charge of the atom (q00). Note that this AIMAll gives q00 without adding the nuclear charge. When obtaining q00 through ichor, the nuclear charge is always added to the q00 value.

recover_molecular_dipole(atoms: Atoms, ints_dir: IntDirectory, convert_to_debye=True, convert_to_spherical=False)

Calculates the recovered MOLECULAR dipole moment from ATOMIC dipole moments from AIMAll, given a geometry (atoms) and an ints_directory, containing the AIMAll calculations for the given geometry.

Parameters:

  • atoms – an Atoms instance containing the system geometry

  • ints_dir – an IntDirectory file instance, which wraps around an AIMAll output directory

  • convert_to_debye – Whether or not to convert the final result to Debye, default to True. This converts from atomic units to Debye. See Appendix D of Anthony Stone “Theory of Intermolecular Forces”

  • convert_to_cartesian – Whether or not to convert the recovered molecular dipole from spherical to Cartesian, defaults to True. Note that Gaussian calculates molecular multipole moments in Cartesian coordinates, so set to True in case you are comparing against Gaussian.

Returns:

A numpy array containing the recovered molecular dipole moment.

rotate_dipole(q10: float, q11c: float, q11s: float, C: ndarray) → Tuple[float, float, float]

Rotates dipole moment from global spherical to local spherical.

Parameters:

  • q10 – q10 component

  • q11c – q11c component

  • q11s – q11s component

  • C – C matrix to use to rotate dipoles

unpack_cartesian_dipole(d)

ichor.core.multipoles.hexadecapole module

pack_cartesian_hexadecapole(h_xxxx, h_xxxy, h_xxxz, h_xxyy, h_xxyz, h_xxzz, h_xyyy, h_xyyz, h_xyzz, h_xzzz, h_yyyy, h_yyyz, h_yyzz, h_yzzz, h_zzzz)
rotate_hexadecapole(q40: float, q41c: float, q41s: float, q42c: float, q42s: float, q43c: float, q43s: float, q44c: float, q44s: float, C: ndarray) → Tuple[float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float, float]

ichor.core.multipoles.octupole module

Bar_func(alpha, beta, gamma, displacement_vector, quadrupole)
Box_func(alpha, beta, gamma, displacement_vector, dipole)
Eta(gamma)
F(alpha, beta, gamma, quadrupole)
F_prime(alpha, beta, gamma, displacement_vector)
Omega_prime(alpha, beta, gamma, displacement_vector: ndarray)
Theta_prime(alpha, beta, displacement_vector)
displace_octupole_cartesian(displacement_vector: array, monopole: float, dipole: ndarray, quadrupole: ndarray, octupole: ndarray)

Calculates a new octupole moment displaced by a displacement vector

Parameters:

  • displacement_vector – array containing x, y, z components of shape 3,

  • monopole – monopole moment (charge), float

  • dipole – dipole moment, array of shape 3,

  • quadrupole – quadrupole moment, matrix of shape 3,3

  • octupole – octupole moment, tensor of shape 3,3,3

Returns:

The displaced octupole moment as array of shape 3,3,3

Return type:

np.ndarray

get_gaussian_and_aimall_molecular_octupole(gaussian_output: GaussianOutput, ints_directory: IntsDir)

Gets the Gaussian octupole moment and converts it to traceless (still in Debye Angstrom^2) Also gets the AIMAll recovered molecule octupole moment from atomic ones.

Returns a tuple of numpy arrays, where the first one is the Gaussian traceless 3x3x3 octupole moment (in Debye Angstrom^2) and the second one is the AIMAll recovered traceless 3x3x3 octupole moment (also converted from au to Debye Angstrom^2) and with prefactor taken into account.

This allows for direct comparison of AIMAll to Gaussian.

Parameters:

  • gaussian_output – A Gaussian output file containing molecular multipole moments and geometry. The same geometry and level of theory must also be used in the AIMAll calculation.

  • ints_directory – A IntsDirectory instance containing the AIMAll .int files for the same geometry that was used in Gaussian

Returns:

A tuple of 3x3x3 np.ndarrays, where the first is the Gaussian octupole moment and the second is the AIMAll recovered octupole moment.

octupole_cartesian_to_spherical(o: ndarray) → Tuple[float, float, float, float, float, float, float]
octupole_element_conversion(octupole_array: ndarray, current_ordering)

Converts between the two ways of reporting octupole moments, namely

0: XXX, YYY, ZZZ, XYY, XXY, XXZ, XZZ, YZZ, YYZ, XYZ and 1: XXX, XXY, XXZ, XYY, XYZ, XZZ, YYY, YYZ, YZZ, ZZZ

where the 0 and 1 indicate the current ordering style.

..note::

The other ordering is going to be returned. If 0 is given as current ordering, ordering 1 is going to be returned. If 1 is given as current ordering, ordering 0 is going to be returned.

Parameters:

  • octupole_array – 1d unpacked octupole array

  • current_ordering – either 0 or 1

octupole_nontraceless_to_traceless(octupole_tensor: ndarray, include_prefactor=False)

Converts a non-traceless octupole to a traceless octupole. GAUSSIAN and ORCA, as well as other computational chemistry software usually only give the non-traceless octupole moments. These must be converted to traceless ones in order to be compared to AIMAll recovered multipole moments.

Parameters:

  • octupole_tensor – The packed (Cartesian) octupole tensor

  • include_prefactor – The prefactor (5/2)

Returns:

The traceless packed (Cartesian) octupole tensor

octupole_one_term_general_expression(alpha: int, beta: int, gamma: int, displacement_vector: ndarray, monopole: float, dipole: ndarray, quadrupole: ndarray, octupole: ndarray)

Calculates a single component of the displaced octupole tensor

Parameters:

  • alpha – 0 1 or 2 for x,y, or z direction

  • beta – 0 1 or 2 for x,y, or z direction

  • gamma – 0 1 or 2 for x,y, or z direction

  • vector (displacement) – displacement vector containing x,y,z displacement

  • monopole – Monopole moment, single float

  • dipole – Dipole moment vector, needs to be a vector of shape 3

  • quadrupole – Quadrupole moment matrix, needs to be 3x3 matrix

  • octupole – Octupole moment tensor, needs to be a 3x3x3 tensor

Returns:

Returns a single element of the Cartesian octupole tensor, Omega_{alpha, beta, gamma} that has been displaced by x y z coordinates

octupole_rotate_cartesian(o: ndarray, C: ndarray) → ndarray
octupole_spherical_to_cartesian(q30: float, q31c: float, q31s: float, q32c: float, q32s: float, q33c: float, q33s: float) → ndarray
pack_cartesian_octupole(o_xxx, o_xxy, o_xxz, o_xyy, o_xyz, o_xzz, o_yyy, o_yyz, o_yzz, o_zzz)
recover_molecular_octupole(atoms: Atoms, ints_dir: IntDirectory, convert_to_debye_angstrom_squared=True, convert_to_cartesian=True, include_prefactor=True)
rotate_octupole(q30: float, q31c: float, q31s: float, q32c: float, q32s: float, q33c: float, q33s: float, C: ndarray) → Tuple[float, float, float, float, float, float, float]

Rotates octupole moments from the global to local frame

unpack_cartesian_octupole(o)

ichor.core.multipoles.quadrupole module

Theta_prime(alpha, beta, displacement_vector)
atomic_contribution_to_molecular_quadrupole(q00, q10, q11c, q11s, q20, q21c, q21s, q22c, q22s, atomic_coordinates)

Calculates the atomic contribution to the molecular quadrupole moment. Note that the moments are in spherical coordinates. Atomic coordinates are assumed to be Bohr.

Note

This is contribution of ONE atom.

Parameters:

  • q00 – The charge of the atom (q00). Note that this AIMAll gives q00 without adding the nuclear charge. When obtaining q00 through ichor, the nuclear charge is always added to the q00 value.

  • q10 – AIMAll q10 value

  • q11c – AIMAll q11c value

  • q11s – AIMAll q11s value

  • q20 – AIMAll q20 value

  • q21c – AIMAll q21c value

  • q21s – AIMAll q21s value

  • q22c – AIMAll q22c value

  • q22s – AIMAll q22s value

  • atomic_coordinates – 1D numpy array containing the x,y,z values (in bohr)

displace_quadrupole_cartesian(displacement_vector: ndarray, monopole: float, dipole: ndarray, quadrupole: ndarray)

Computes the full displaced quadrupole moment

Parameters:

  • displacement_vector – Displacement vector

  • monopole – monopole moment, float (charge of atom or system). Note that for AIMAll, the atomic q00 (monopole) in the AIMAll .int file does not have the nuclear charge added ichor automatically does that when parsing .int files.

  • dipole – The atomic or molecular dipole moment np.ndarray containing x,y,z components of displacement vector (Cartesian

  • quadrupole – The atomic or molecular quadrupole moment (3x3) matrix in Cartesian coordinates

Returns:

np.ndarray of shape (3x3) containing displaced quadrupole moment

get_gaussian_and_aimall_molecular_quadrupole(gaussian_output: GaussianOutput, ints_directory: IntsDir)

Gets the Gaussian quadrupole moment and converts it to traceless (still in Debye Angstrom^2) Also gets the AIMAll recovered molecule quadrupole moment from atomic ones.

Returns a tuple of numpy arrays, where the first one is the Gaussian traceless 3x3 quadrupole moment (in Debye Angstrom) and the second one is the AIMAll recovered traceless 3x3 quadrupole moment (also converted from au to Debye Angstrom) and with prefactor taken into account.

This allows for direct comparison of AIMAll to Gaussian.

Parameters:

  • gaussian_output – A Gaussian output file containing molecular multipole moments and geometry. The same geometry and level of theory must also be used in the AIMAll calculation.

  • ints_directory – A IntsDirectory instance containing the AIMAll .int files for the same geometry that was used in Gaussian

Returns:

A tuple of 3x3 np.ndarrays, where the first is the Gaussian quadrupole moment and the second is the AIMAll recovered quadrupole moment.

pack_cartesian_quadrupole(q_xx, q_xy, q_xz, q_yy, q_yz, q_zz)
q20_prime(q20: float, q10: float, q11c: float, q11s: float, q00: float, r_x: float, r_y: float, r_z: float)

Calculates math:Q’_{20}:, representing the total ATOMIC contribution for the molecular quadrupole math:Q_{20}:

Note

This is the contribution of one atom, which needs to be summed over to get the molecular value. Also, make sure the units for multipole moments / distances are correct.

Parameters:

  • q20 – AIMAll q20 value

  • q10 – AIMAll q10 value

  • q11c – AIMAll q11c value

  • q11s – AIMAll q11s value

  • q00 – The charge of the atom (q00). Note that this AIMAll gives q00 without adding the nuclear charge. When obtaining q00 through ichor, the nuclear charge is always added to the q00 value.

  • r_x – Distance of atom from the origin in the x-direction. In Bohr.

  • r_y – Distance of atom from the origin in the y-direction. In Bohr.

  • r_z – Distance of atom from the origin in the z-direction. In Bohr.

q21c_prime(q21c: float, q11c: float, q10: float, q00: float, r_x: float, r_z: float)

Calculates math:Q’_{21c}:, representing the total ATOMIC contribution for the molecular quadrupole math:Q_{21c}:

Note

This is the contribution of one atom, which needs to be summed over to get the molecular value. Also, make sure the units for multipole moments / distances are correct.

Parameters:

  • q21c – AIMAll q21c value

  • q11c – AIMAll q11c value

  • q10 – AIMAll q10 value

  • q00 – The charge of the atom (q00). Note that this AIMAll gives q00 without adding the nuclear charge. When obtaining q00 through ichor, the nuclear charge is always added to the q00 value.

  • r_x – Distance of atom from the origin in the x-direction. In Bohr.

  • r_z – Distance of atom from the origin in the z-direction. In Bohr.

q21s_prime(q21s: float, q11s: float, q10: float, q00: float, r_y: float, r_z: float)

Calculates math:Q’_{21s}:, representing the total ATOMIC contribution for the molecular quadrupole math:Q_{21s}:

Note

This is the contribution of one atom, which needs to be summed over to get the molecular value. Also, make sure the units for multipole moments / distances are correct.

Parameters:

  • q21s – AIMAll q21s value

  • q11s – AIMAll q11s value

  • q10 – AIMAll q10 value

  • q00 – The charge of the atom (q00). Note that this AIMAll gives q00 without adding the nuclear charge. When obtaining q00 through ichor, the nuclear charge is always added to the q00 value.

  • r_y – Distance of atom from the origin in the y-direction. In Bohr.

  • r_z – Distance of atom from the origin in the z-direction. In Bohr.

q22c_prime(q22c: float, q11c: float, q11s: float, q00: float, r_x: float, r_y: float)

Calculates math:Q’_{22c}:, representing the total ATOMIC contribution for the molecular quadrupole math:Q_{22c}:

Note

This is the contribution of one atom, which needs to be summed over to get the molecular value. Also, make sure the units for multipole moments / distances are correct.

Parameters:

  • q22c – AIMAll q22c value

  • q11c – AIMAll q11c value

  • q11s – AIMAll q11s value

  • q00 – The charge of the atom (q00). Note that this AIMAll gives q00 without adding the nuclear charge. When obtaining q00 through ichor, the nuclear charge is always added to the q00 value.

  • r_x – Distance of atom from the origin in the x-direction. In Bohr.

  • r_y – Distance of atom from the origin in the y-direction. In Bohr.

q22s_prime(q22s: float, q11c: float, q11s: float, q00: float, r_x: float, r_y: float)

Calculates math:Q’_{22s}:, representing the total ATOMIC contribution for the molecular quadrupole math:Q_{22s}:

Note

This is the contribution of one atom, which needs to be summed over to get the molecular value. Also, make sure the units for multipole moments / distances are correct.

Parameters:

  • q22s – AIMAll q22s value

  • q11c – AIMAll q11c value

  • q11s – AIMAll q11s value

  • q00 – The charge of the atom (q00). Note that this AIMAll gives q00 without adding the nuclear charge. When obtaining q00 through ichor, the nuclear charge is always added to the q00 value.

  • r_x – Distance of atom from the origin in the x-direction. In Bohr.

  • r_y – Distance of atom from the origin in the y-direction. In Bohr.

quadrupole_cartesian_to_spherical(q: ndarray) → Tuple[float, float, float, float, float]
quadrupole_element_conversion(quadrupole_array: ndarray, current_ordering)

Converts between the two ways of reporting quadrupole moments, namely

0: xx, yy, zz, xy, xz, yz this is the ordering used by GAUSSIAN/ORCA and 1: xx, xy, xz, yy, yz, zz

where the 0 and 1 indicate the ordering index. The other ordering is going to be returned

Parameters:

quadrupole_array – 1d unpacked quadrupole array

quadrupole_nontraceless_to_traceless(nontraceless_quadrupole_matrix: ndarray) → ndarray

Subtracts off a constant (the mean of the sum of the trace), which makes the quadrupole moment traceless (i.e. the new sum of the diagonal is 0.0)

Note

AIMAll already gives traceless moments, but Gaussian does not have traceless moments for higher order multipole moments (higher than quadrupole.)

Parameters:

nontraceless_quadrupole_matrix – A 3x3 matrix containing the (packed) quadrupole moment

Returns:

A 3x3 matrix containing the traceless quadrupole moment

quadrupole_one_term_general_expression(alpha: int, beta: int, displacement_vector: ndarray, monopole: float, dipole: ndarray, quadrupole: ndarray) → float

Origin change of one component of the quadrupole moment by a displacement vector

Parameters:

  • alpha – 0, 1, or 2 for x, y, or z

  • beta – 0, 1, or 2 for x, y, or z

  • displacement_vector – np.ndarray containing x,y,z components of displacement vector

  • monopole – monopole moment, float (charge of atom or system). Note that for AIMAll, the q00 in the AIMAll .int file does not have the nuclear charge added ichor automatically does that when parsing .int files.

  • dipole – The atomic or molecular dipole moment np.ndarray containing x,y,z components of displacement vector (Cartesian)

  • quadrupole – The atomic or molecular quadrupole moment (3x3) matrix in Cartesian coordinates

Returns:

The component of the quadrupole moment, as seen from the new origin

quadrupole_rotate_cartesian(q: ndarray, C: ndarray) → ndarray
quadrupole_spherical_to_cartesian(q20, q21c, q21s, q22c, q22s) → ndarray
recover_molecular_quadrupole(atoms: Atoms, ints_dir: IntDirectory, convert_to_debye_angstrom=True, convert_to_cartesian=True, include_prefactor=True)

Calculates the recovered MOLECULAR quadrupole moment from ATOMIC quadrupole moments from AIMAll, given a geometry (atoms) and an ints_directory, containing the AIMAll calculations for the given geometry.

Note

Assumes atomic multipole moment units are atomic units (Coulomb Bohr**2) because this is what AIMAll gives.

Parameters:

  • atoms – an Atoms instance containing the system geometry

  • ints_dir – an IntDirectory file instance, which wraps around an AIMAll output directory

  • convert_to_debye – Whether or not to convert the final result to DebyeAngstrom (from au), default to True.

  • convert_to_cartesian – Whether or not to convert the recovered molecular quadrupole from spherical to Cartesian, defaults to True.

  • prefactor – Include the (2/3) prefactor. Useful to directly compare to Gaussian

Returns:

A numpy array containing the molecular quadrupole moment.

rotate_quadrupole(q20: float, q21c: float, q21s: float, q22c: float, q22s: float, C: ndarray) → Tuple[float, float, float, float, float]

Rotates quadrupole moments from the global to local frame

  • monopole – monopole moment, float (charge of atom or system). Note that for AIMAll, the atomic q00 (monopole) in the AIMAll .int file does not have the nuclear charge added ichor automatically does that when parsing .int files.

  • dipole – The atomic or molecular dipole moment np.ndarray containing x,y,z components of displacement vector (Cartesian

Returns:

np.ndarray of shape 3 containing x,y, and z components of displaced dipole moment

displace_octupole_cartesian(displacement_vector: array, monopole: float, dipole: ndarray, quadrupole: ndarray, octupole: ndarray)

Calculates a new octupole moment displaced by a displacement vector

Parameters:

  • displacement_vector – array containing x, y, z components of shape 3,

  • monopole – monopole moment (charge), float

  • dipole – dipole moment, array of shape 3,

  • quadrupole – quadrupole moment, matrix of shape 3,3

  • octupole – octupole moment, tensor of shape 3,3,3

Returns:

The displaced octupole moment as array of shape 3,3,3

Return type:

np.ndarray

displace_quadrupole_cartesian(displacement_vector: ndarray, monopole: float, dipole: ndarray, quadrupole: ndarray)

Computes the full displaced quadrupole moment

Parameters:

  • displacement_vector – Displacement vector

  • monopole – monopole moment, float (charge of atom or system). Note that for AIMAll, the atomic q00 (monopole) in the AIMAll .int file does not have the nuclear charge added ichor automatically does that when parsing .int files.

  • dipole – The atomic or molecular dipole moment np.ndarray containing x,y,z components of displacement vector (Cartesian

  • quadrupole – The atomic or molecular quadrupole moment (3x3) matrix in Cartesian coordinates

Returns:

np.ndarray of shape (3x3) containing displaced quadrupole moment

get_gaussian_and_aimall_molecular_dipole(gaussian_output: GaussianOutput, ints_directory: IntsDir)

Gets the Gaussian dipole moment (still in Debye) Also gets the AIMAll recovered molecule dipole moment from atomic ones.

Returns a tuple of numpy arrays, where the first one is the Gaussian traceless dipole moment (in Debye) and the second one is the AIMAll recovered traceless dipole moment (also converted from au to Debye)

This allows for direct comparison of AIMAll to Gaussian.

Parameters:

  • gaussian_output – A Gaussian output file containing molecular multipole moments and geometry. The same geometry and level of theory must also be used in the AIMAll calculation.

  • ints_directory – A IntsDirectory instance containing the AIMAll .int files for the same geometry that was used in Gaussian

Returns:

A tuple of np.ndarrays of shape (3,) , where the first is the Gaussian dipole moment and the second is the AIMAll recovered dipole moment.

get_gaussian_and_aimall_molecular_octupole(gaussian_output: GaussianOutput, ints_directory: IntsDir)

Gets the Gaussian octupole moment and converts it to traceless (still in Debye Angstrom^2) Also gets the AIMAll recovered molecule octupole moment from atomic ones.

Returns a tuple of numpy arrays, where the first one is the Gaussian traceless 3x3x3 octupole moment (in Debye Angstrom^2) and the second one is the AIMAll recovered traceless 3x3x3 octupole moment (also converted from au to Debye Angstrom^2) and with prefactor taken into account.

This allows for direct comparison of AIMAll to Gaussian.

Parameters:

  • gaussian_output – A Gaussian output file containing molecular multipole moments and geometry. The same geometry and level of theory must also be used in the AIMAll calculation.

  • ints_directory – A IntsDirectory instance containing the AIMAll .int files for the same geometry that was used in Gaussian

Returns:

A tuple of 3x3x3 np.ndarrays, where the first is the Gaussian octupole moment and the second is the AIMAll recovered octupole moment.

get_gaussian_and_aimall_molecular_quadrupole(gaussian_output: GaussianOutput, ints_directory: IntsDir)

Gets the Gaussian quadrupole moment and converts it to traceless (still in Debye Angstrom^2) Also gets the AIMAll recovered molecule quadrupole moment from atomic ones.

Returns a tuple of numpy arrays, where the first one is the Gaussian traceless 3x3 quadrupole moment (in Debye Angstrom) and the second one is the AIMAll recovered traceless 3x3 quadrupole moment (also converted from au to Debye Angstrom) and with prefactor taken into account.

This allows for direct comparison of AIMAll to Gaussian.

Parameters:

  • gaussian_output – A Gaussian output file containing molecular multipole moments and geometry. The same geometry and level of theory must also be used in the AIMAll calculation.

  • ints_directory – A IntsDirectory instance containing the AIMAll .int files for the same geometry that was used in Gaussian

Returns:

A tuple of 3x3 np.ndarrays, where the first is the Gaussian quadrupole moment and the second is the AIMAll recovered quadrupole moment.

recover_molecular_dipole(atoms: Atoms, ints_dir: IntDirectory, convert_to_debye=True, convert_to_spherical=False)

Calculates the recovered MOLECULAR dipole moment from ATOMIC dipole moments from AIMAll, given a geometry (atoms) and an ints_directory, containing the AIMAll calculations for the given geometry.

Parameters:

  • atoms – an Atoms instance containing the system geometry

  • ints_dir – an IntDirectory file instance, which wraps around an AIMAll output directory

  • convert_to_debye – Whether or not to convert the final result to Debye, default to True. This converts from atomic units to Debye. See Appendix D of Anthony Stone “Theory of Intermolecular Forces”

  • convert_to_cartesian – Whether or not to convert the recovered molecular dipole from spherical to Cartesian, defaults to True. Note that Gaussian calculates molecular multipole moments in Cartesian coordinates, so set to True in case you are comparing against Gaussian.

Returns:

A numpy array containing the recovered molecular dipole moment.

recover_molecular_octupole(atoms: Atoms, ints_dir: IntDirectory, convert_to_debye_angstrom_squared=True, convert_to_cartesian=True, include_prefactor=True)
recover_molecular_quadrupole(atoms: Atoms, ints_dir: IntDirectory, convert_to_debye_angstrom=True, convert_to_cartesian=True, include_prefactor=True)

Calculates the recovered MOLECULAR quadrupole moment from ATOMIC quadrupole moments from AIMAll, given a geometry (atoms) and an ints_directory, containing the AIMAll calculations for the given geometry.

Note

Assumes atomic multipole moment units are atomic units (Coulomb Bohr**2) because this is what AIMAll gives.

Parameters:

  • atoms – an Atoms instance containing the system geometry

  • ints_dir – an IntDirectory file instance, which wraps around an AIMAll output directory

  • convert_to_debye – Whether or not to convert the final result to DebyeAngstrom (from au), default to True.

  • convert_to_cartesian – Whether or not to convert the recovered molecular quadrupole from spherical to Cartesian, defaults to True.

  • prefactor – Include the (2/3) prefactor. Useful to directly compare to Gaussian

Returns:

A numpy array containing the molecular quadrupole moment.

rotate_dipole(q10: float, q11c: float, q11s: float, C: ndarray) → Tuple[float, float, float]

Rotates dipole moment from global spherical to local spherical.

Parameters:

  • q10 – q10 component

  • q11c – q11c component

  • q11s – q11s component

  • C – C matrix to use to rotate dipoles
